sources.title: Boothill Brigade
sources.description: Rancher Reynolds (Frank LaRue) has fired his men and hired killers and is now using a crooked land deal to put the other ranchers off their land. Calico (Horace Murphy) finds the reason why when he runs into his old nemesis Porter (Ed Cassidy).

sources.title: Boothill Brigade
sources.description: Title: Boothill Brigade Summary: Rancher Reynolds has fired his men and hired killers and is now using a crooked land deal to put the other ranchers off their land. Calico finds the reason why when he runs into his old nemesis Porter. Directed by: Sam Newfield Actors: Johnny Mack Brown, Claire Rochelle, Dick Curtis Production Company: Supreme Pictures Release Date: 2 August 1937 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Rancher Reynolds has fired his men and hired killers and is now using a crooked land deal to put the other ranchers off their land. Calico finds the reason why when he runs into his old nemesis Porter.

sources.title: Boothill Brigade (1937) JOHNNY MACK BROWN
sources.description:
Stars: Johnny Mack Brown, Claire Rochelle, Dick Curtis
Director: Sam Newfield

Rancher Reynolds has fired his men and hired killers and is now using a crooked land deal to put the other ranchers off their land. Calico finds the reason why when he runs into his old nemesis Porter.

metadata.Plot: Lon Cardigan (Johnny Mack Brown) and his sweetheart, Bobbie Reynolds (Claire Rocvhelle), are bewildered when her father, Jeff Reynolds (Frank LaRue), fires all of his cowhands and hires a motley gang of thugs. Lon accept's Reynold's offer of the job oh herd boss. It soon becomes apparent that Reynolds is dominated by John Porter (Edward Cassidy) for some reason. A group of squatters informs Lon they are being evicted from their homesteads because Reynolds has , at public auction, bought up the entire strip pf land which they always considered their own under squatter's rights. Because of this, Lon quits Reynolds and sides with the squatters. Calico Haynes, the ranch cook, steals a piece of paper from Porter which shows Reynolds is deeding all of the land he acquired to Porter under some kind of compulsion.
metadata.Writer: Harry F. Olmsted, George H. Plympton
metadata.Actors: Johnny Mack Brown, Claire Rochelle, Dick Curtis
